definition: honestly speaking/to be frank, ...

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
real/true/honest/really/solid/fruit/seed/definitely
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
variant of 說|说[shuo1]
to speak the truth/truth to tell/frankly
returning to our main topic,.../that said,.../again,.../in this connection/in passing/nevertheless,.../anyhow
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
to be honest, ...
as far as I know/to the best of my knowledge
to think about it
it may be assumed that
moreover/besides/in addition/furthermore
to care about/to take offense/to mind
contrary to what one might expect/actually/contrariwise/why don't you
if it were not for/but for
not to mention/leaving aside
to appear to be/to seem as if
(exclamation)/to hiccup
indeed/true! (I agree with you)
only/merely/nothing but/no more than/it's just that ...
